result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Anthony Uzoma Nwadike in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant is actively working on obtaining a valid license but requests additional time to pay fines in order to reinstate his license.  The Court grants the request and schedules 2014CT1866 case for jury trial and this case to tag along.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2017 at 10:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on December 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Anthony Uzoma Nwadike did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Bricco advises the Court the Defendant is still in the process of obtaining a license and requests the Court allow additional time.  Attorney Bricco requests the Court stay any capias.   The State takes no position.  The court stays the capias until the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Uzoma Nwadike in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court quashes the previously stayed capias. The Court schedules the cases for plea and sentencing in early November.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
